p: In one study, ribavarin 200Â mg twice daily for 1 week was tried on ten patients with chronic CHIK compared to placebo, with some effect [ 41]. Other promising molecules reported to have some efficacy in CHIK are bindarit [ 42], an inhibitor of monocyte chemoattractant protein-1 (MCP-1), inhibitors targeting the mannose-binding lectin (MBL) pathway of the complement system [ 43] and beclin, which is an autophagy-inducing peptide [ 44]. Other potential drugs with anti-CHIK action are niclosamide, nitazoxanide and suramin, all of which inhibit virus entry, fusion, binding and cell-to-cell transmission [ 45, 46].
